newsitem.title: UK: Zinc to break above $1,550 by early 1998-Waterside.
newsitem.headline: Zinc to break above $1,550 by early 1998-Waterside.

text.p: Three months LME zinc is expected to surpass a medium-term target of $1,550 by early 1998, Waterside Futures said in its latest report.
An interim objective is $1,325, the report, which uses Elliott Wave analysis, added.
"The complex nature of advances that began from $960 in 1995 suggests the final route towards $1,325 will be composed of several movements of new highs then declines," the Wavetrack report said.
In the shorter term, after prices attain a target of $1,279, they will retrace 38.2 percent to $1,173, it added.
"Watch this to set the trading range for sideways activity for a little longer," it said.
In nickel, long-term patterns suggest a bull market that will take prices to $13,000.

"The explosive nature of the rally from the December low is certainly the kind of activity that we expect to see at the beginning of a nickel bull market and patterns are unfolding impulsively," the report said.
"The recent hesitation at the $8,000-$8,200 area is no cause for concern yet and the market is likely to accelerate upwards immediately. No significant resistance is seen until $9,030," it added.
The market should then drop to a strong support level of $7,630 with the bull market resuming afterwards.
Copper will find short-term critical resistance at $2,416/17, which represents the next leg of the move that began at $1,745 in June 1996 and hit $2,160 less than three months later.
The current target is 61.8 percent of the initial $415 rise added to the previous top of $2,160.
Over the next several weeks, the market is expected to slide back towards $2,160 before eventually heading up to a longer term target of $2,830/50.
In aluminium, an interim move should conclude a five-wave pattern at around $2,228 by the end of the year.

The first wave concluded a move from last year's low around $1,300 up to $1,651 in January 1997, with the next movement a shallow retracement to $1,534. "That action suggests a third phase of price advances is now underway. It is usually much larger than the first, hence targets towards $2,095," it said.
